ws.rocket.config

Class MapConfigModel<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ws.rocket.config.MapConfigModel<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The target type that will hold the read configuration of each section.

    public final class MapConfigModel<T>
extends Object
    A configuration model that has only one section (type) but can parse a file with multiple section, excepting them all to have same section format. This model, when parsed, returns an unordered map, where read section names are stored as map keys, and section data is stored as a map value (per map key) in an instance of the target bean type.
    Author:
    Martti Tamm

    • Method Detail

      • expect

        public static <T> MapConfigModel<T> expect(Class<T> confInstanceType,
                           String... propNames)
        The factory method for constructing a new map-based model for given configuration bean type. The returned configuration model allows unlimited amount of sections where section name is used as map key, and the section data is used to create a new instance of configuration bean (per section).
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the configuration bean.
        Parameters:
        confInstanceType - The type of the configuration bean.
        propNames - Optional array of allowed property names. When empty, all properties are attempted.
        Returns:
        The created configuration model.

      • expect

        public static <T> MapConfigModel<T> expect(Class<T> confInstanceType,
                           ValueConverter converter,
                           String... propNames)
        The factory method for constructing a new map-based model for given configuration bean type. The returned configuration model allows unlimited amount of sections where section name is used as map key, and the section data is used to create a new instance of configuration bean (per section).
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the configuration bean.
        Parameters:
        confInstanceType - The type of the configuration bean.
        converter - A custom value converter to use for String to runtime type value conversions.
        propNames - Optional array of allowed property names. When empty, all properties are attempted.
        Returns:
        The created configuration model.

      • getConfigBeanType

        Informative method: provides the bean type that will be returned after conversion.
        Returns:

      • parse

        public Map<String,T> parse(InputStream input)
                    throws ConfigException
        Parses the input stream expecting sections with configuration settings. Each section will be parsed as defined in this model. Serious conflicts in stream can eventually trigger ConfigException, while minor conflicts (bad setting lines) might just be logged as warnings.

        The order of sections in the configuration file will not be preserved in the returned map.

        Each section is parsed as rows of key-value pairs, and each section triggers creation of the target bean with the read data.

        At first, it attempts to call a constructor with as many constructor parameters as defined in section writer (a parameter value will be read from the map where parameter name corresponds to map key). When this approach fails, it attempts to initialize the bean using default constructor, and set the required (when parameter names are given to writer) or all (otherwise) properties of the bean.

        Failing to initialize bean or failing to set a declared property will raise ConfigException.

        Parameters:
        input - Configuration stream. When null then ConfigException will be raised.
        Returns:
        A new instance of configuration object with data set as defined in the stream.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - Contains error and possibly also warning messages from parsing the stream.

      • describeTo

        public void describeTo(PrintStream out)
        Provides textual representation of the current model setup and writes it to the provided stream.

        Applications might use this to enlist what settings are available and how a configuration file should look like. The output of this method should not be considered as valid setup, nor is it guaranteed to be always syntactically correct.

        Parameters:
        out - The stream where to write.
        See Also:
        toString()

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Provides textual representation of the current model setup and returns it as string.

        Returns:
        Textual representation of model setup.
